| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | [monst.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 2725](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.6.0/monst.c#line2725 "Source:NetHack 3.6.0/monst.c") |

A **barbarian** is a [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") corresponding to the [barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian") [role](/wiki/Role "Role"). Like a player barbarian, they have [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

## Generation

- *Main article: [Player monster#Generation](/wiki/Player_monster#Generation "Player monster")*

Like other player monsters, barbarians are never randomly generated and are thus rarely seen. They are normally found on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), where they may appears among the hostile player monsters.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Most barbarians encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be [doppelgangers](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger"), which may temporarily assume their form; in either case, the game refers to them by the [rank](/wiki/Rank "Rank") title appropriate for the monster's level.

Reading a cursed [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") as a barbarian while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") will summon a number of barbarian monsters, although they won't have their usual equipment. Using [undead turning](/wiki/Undead_turning "Undead turning") on the corpse of a dead barbarian or using [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") on a barbarian statue will revive them as a player monster. In addition to [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") levels, barbarian corpses can be found in graveyards including those in the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead"),[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) and their statues may appear on [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island")[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) as well as in [cockatrice nests](/wiki/Cockatrice_nest "Cockatrice nest").

### Equipment

- *Main article: [Player monster#Equipment](/wiki/Player_monster#Equipment "Player monster")*

A barbarian on the Astral Plane will carry either a [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword"), a [battle-axe](/wiki/Battle-axe "Battle-axe"), a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") or a randomly chosen [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") weapon with 25% probability each. The [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon")'s [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") will be random between +4 and +8, and it will be either [erodeproof](/wiki/Erodeproof "Erodeproof") or [greased](/wiki/Greased "Greased") (but not both) with 33.3% probability each. There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") of the same type, if possible.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, barbarians will also be equipped with [1d3](/wiki/D_notation "D notation") random [offensive items](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), 1d3 random [defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item") and 1d3 random [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item"), a randomly generated [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") containing various pieces of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") as well as a [cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor"), some [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") and other items. The ascension kit given to barbarians will not include a [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") if they are wielding a two-handed sword or a battle-axe, has only a 50% chance of including [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail") instead of non-magical body armor, and will never include a [helm of brilliance](/wiki/Helm_of_brilliance "Helm of brilliance").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [create\_mplayers](/wiki/Source:Mplayer.c#create_mplayers "Source:Mplayer.c") in [mplayer.c](/wiki/Source:Mplayer.c "Source:Mplayer.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [dat/gehennom.des in NetHack 3.6.0, line 81](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/dat/gehennom.des#L81)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/sp\_lev.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1896](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/sp_lev.c#L1896): *the code is very cryptic but fortunately has comments*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [mk\_mplayer](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.6.1/mplayer.c#mk_mplayer "Source:NetHack 3.6.1/mplayer.c") in [mplayer.c](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.6.1/mplayer.c "Source:NetHack 3.6.1/mplayer.c") in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.](/images/3/37/Nh364-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

Barbarian (player monster)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ barbarian
Difficulty 12
Attacks Weapon 1d6, weapon 1d6
@ barbarian
Difficulty 12
Attacks

Weapon 1d6, weapon 1d6

Base level 10
Base experience 221
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 1
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No (unless player is a barbarian)
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed None

A barbarian:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 2725

A barbarian is a player monster corresponding to the barbarian role. Like a player barbarian, they have intrinsic poison resistance.

Generation

Main article: Player monster#Generation

Like other player monsters, barbarians are never randomly generated and are thus rarely seen. They are normally found on the Astral Plane, where they may appears among the hostile player monsters.[1] Most barbarians encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be doppelgangers, which may temporarily assume their form; in either case, the game refers to them by the rank title appropriate for the monster's level.

Reading a cursed scroll of genocide as a barbarian while confused will summon a number of barbarian monsters, although they won't have their usual equipment. Using undead turning on the corpse of a dead barbarian or using stone to flesh on a barbarian statue will revive them as a player monster. In addition to bones levels, barbarian corpses can be found in graveyards including those in the Valley of the Dead,[2] and their statues may appear on Medusa's Island[3] as well as in cockatrice nests.

Equipment

Main article: Player monster#Equipment

A barbarian on the Astral Plane will carry either a two-handed sword, a battle-axe, a long sword or a randomly chosen melee weapon with 25% probability each. The weapon's enchantment will be random between +4 and +8, and it will be either erodeproof or greased (but not both) with 33.3% probability each. There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an artifact of the same type, if possible.[4]

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, barbarians will also be equipped with 1d3 random offensive items, 1d3 random defensive items and 1d3 random miscellaneous items, a randomly generated ascension kit containing various pieces of armor as well as a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor, some gold and other items. The ascension kit given to barbarians will not include a shield if they are wielding a two-handed sword or a battle-axe, has only a 50% chance of including dragon scale mail instead of non-magical body armor, and will never include a helm of brilliance.

References

  1. ↑ create_mplayers in mplayer.c
  2. ↑ dat/gehennom.des in NetHack 3.6.0, line 81
  3. ↑ src/sp_lev.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1896: the code is very cryptic but fortunately has comments
  4. ↑ mk_mplayer in mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.1

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.4. Information on this page may be out of date.

A '''barbarian''' is a [[player monster]] corresponding to the [[barbarian]] [[role]]. Like a player barbarian, they have [[intrinsic]] [[poison resistance]].

==Generation==
{{main|Player monster#Generation}}

Like other player monsters, barbarians are never randomly generated and are thus rarely seen. They are normally found on the [[Astral Plane]], where they may appears among the hostile player monsters.<ref>{{function|mplayer.c|create_mplayers|version=NetHack 3.6.0}}</ref> Most barbarians encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be [[doppelganger]]s, which may temporarily assume their form; in either case, the game refers to them by the [[rank]] title appropriate for the monster's level.

Reading a cursed [[scroll of genocide]] as a barbarian while [[confused]] will summon a number of barbarian monsters, although they won't have their usual equipment. Using [[undead turning]] on the corpse of a dead barbarian or using [[stone to flesh]] on a barbarian statue will revive them as a player monster. In addition to [[bones]] levels, barbarian corpses can be found in graveyards including those in the [[Valley of the Dead]],{{refsrc|dat/gehennom.des|81|version=NetHack 3.6.0}} and their statues may appear on [[Medusa's Island]]{{refsrc|src/sp_lev.c|1896|version=NetHack 3.6.0|comment= the code is very cryptic but fortunately has comments}} as well as in [[cockatrice nest]]s.

=== Equipment ===
{{main|Player monster#Equipment}}

A barbarian on the Astral Plane will carry either a [[two-handed sword]], a [[battle-axe]], a [[long sword]] or a randomly chosen [[melee]] weapon with 25% probability each. The [[weapon]]'s [[enchantment]] will be random between +4 and +8, and it will be either [[erodeproof]] or [[greased]] (but not both) with 33.3% probability each. There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an [[artifact]] of the same type, if possible.{{reffunc|mplayer.c|mk_mplayer|version=NetHack 3.6.1}}

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, barbarians will also be equipped with [[d notation|1d3]] random [[offensive item]]s, 1d3 random [[defensive item]]s and 1d3 random [[miscellaneous item]]s, a randomly generated [[ascension kit]] containing various pieces of [[armor]] as well as a [[cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor]], some [[gold]] and other items. The ascension kit given to barbarians will not include a [[shield]] if they are wielding a two-handed sword or a battle-axe, has only a 50% chance of including [[dragon scale mail]] instead of non-magical body armor, and will never include a [[helm of brilliance]].
